name: Greek Association of Renewable Electricity Producers
goal:
The Greek Association of Renewable Electricity Producers (GAREP), founded back in 1997, is the biggest one in Greece and represents over a quarter of the installed RE capacity in Greece, namely more than 1300 MW, and the whole range of commercial RE technologies (wind, PV, small hydro and biomass). GAREP’s member companies are particularly active in wind energy.
According to its constitution and by-laws, GAREP’s goals are:
a) The representation of its member-companies before Greek, European and International authorities and organizations
b) Informing its member-companies on issues relevant to their business activities
c) The development of relations and contacts between the member-companies GAREP and Greek, EU and International organizations of related activities
d) Preparatory support work concerning the drafting of laws which are related directly or indirectly to the activities of its members, thus contributing to the formulation of proposals on behalf of its members in reference to the appropriate legal framework for the improved promotion and utilization of wind energy as well as of the other renewable energy sources
e) The development of cooperation with European and International associations and organizations
f) The implementation of studies and the formulation of proposals for the improved utilization of wind energy as well as of other renewable sources, such as solar etc, for the promotion of healthy competition and for the application of rules of ethics
g) The implementation of studies and the formulation of proposals for the improvement of the performance of its members for the harmonious cooperation and solidarity between them in general and for the training of their employees
h) The promotion of wind power as well as of the other renewable energy sources as renewable energies, as sources for the production of electrical energy, through the organization of seminars, conferences, symposia, and related activities as well as the publication – independent of media type- and distribution to its members and / or third parties, at a price or for free of periodical publications, leaflets, books, research products as well as information relevant to renewable energy sources
i) The formation of committees which will work on institutional issues of interest to its members concerning their relations with relevant authorities and organizations
j) The development of relations and contacts between its members and the Greek, European and International banking and insurance institutions as well as informing the members in relation to the better promotion and the productive utilization of wind energy and other renewables
k) GAREP’s participation in EU programmes and the provision of services related to its activities towards third parties
interests: Climate Action, Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Single market
euInitiatives:
Main EU initiatives, policies and legislative files currently followed by GAREP concern the European Commission’ s proposed Clean Energy Package for All Europeans and include but are not limited to the following:

1. The revision of the Renewable Energy Directive
2. The revision of the Electricity Market Directive
3. The revision of the Electricity Market Regulation
4. The Regulation on the Governance of the Energy Union
5. The Energy Efficiency Directive

GAREP is particularly interested in improving the final formulation of the Clean Energy Package in a direction that would establish the optimal conditions for the increase of the implementation of RES projects and secure a level playing field for independent power production both in Greece and in the EU over the next decade.
